snippet: Seeking to address criticism of its privacy practices, the social networking site said it would provide a downloadable archive of the many types of data on individuals that it stores and tracks.
abstract: Facebook will provide users with a downloadable archive of the data it tracks and stores in an effort to address criticism of its privacy practices; information goes beyond the first archive made available in 2010, which has been criticized as incomplete by privacy advocates and regulators; Facebook is trying to accommodate government officials in Europe, where stronger privacy laws exist, as it prepares for an initial public stock offering.
lead_paragraph: Seeking to address criticism of its privacy practices, the social networking site said it would provide a downloadable archive of the many types of data on individuals that it stores and tracks.

headline.seo: Facebook Offers More Disclosure to Users
headline.main: Facebook Offers More Disclosure to Users
headline.print_headline: Facebook, Eye on Privacy Laws, Offers More Disclosure to Users
